definition: circle/ring/loop/classifier for loops, orbits, laps of race etc/CL:個|个[ge4]/to surround/to circle
to confine/to lock up/to pen in

sentences.english: I encourage patients to find a way to break the cycle.
sentences.chinese: 我鼓勵患者發現一種打破怪圈的方法。

sentences.english: But they argue that many crop circles - perhaps 20% - defy rational explanation.
sentences.chinese: 但是他們認爲大約20%的麥田怪圈缺乏合理的解釋。

sentences.english: The problem is that most of us, and I fell into this trap too, put it off.
sentences.chinese: 問題是大部分人，連我也陷進了這樣的怪圈。

sentences.english: Emerson could not stand this repetitive cycle.
sentences.chinese: 愛默生受不了這樣循環的怪圈。

sentences.english: A crop circle can cause hundreds of pounds of damage.
sentences.chinese: 一個麥田怪圈能導致好幾百英鎊的損失。

sentences.english: Workers are trapped in a cycle of poverty with no escape.
sentences.chinese: 工人們陷入貧困的怪圈裏，無力自拔。

sentences.english: In the next two weeks there should be a burst of activity.
sentences.chinese: 接下來的兩個星期，怪圈數量應該會驟增。

sentences.english: This strange loop implies the absurdity of the world.
sentences.chinese: 怪圈提示着世界的荒謬性。

sentences.english: In fact, crop circles only date back about 30 years.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，麥田怪圈的歷史僅追溯到30年前。

sentences.english: The odd group that excessive to the machine infatuation causes makes a person thoughtful.
sentences.chinese: 對機器過度迷戀引發的怪圈令人深思。

sentences.english: Kirk breaks the daughter-only pattern of long marriages documented thus far.
sentences.chinese: 科克走出了在此之前持久婚姻只生女兒的怪圈。

sentences.english: Circles within circles, as they say.
sentences.chinese: 就像他們說的，這就是一個怪圈。

sentences.english: Now, though, BMW is attempting to break the cycle.
sentences.chinese: 然而現在，寶馬正試圖打破這個怪圈。

sentences.english: The little dot near the centre is the decimal point.
sentences.chinese: 怪圈中心近處的那個小圓圈，就是小數點。

sentences.english: The mindset and the strange historical circle of "power leading to hegemony" are not suitable for China.
sentences.chinese: “國強必霸”的歷史怪圈和思維定式不適合中國。

definition: to sink into/to get caught up in/to land in (a predicament)
to fall deeper and deeper (in debt, in love etc)
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
